scenarios.name: The Greatest Job in the World

events.narrative:
There's a saying: "Mess with the Sleeping Lion and you'll get the Jaws." Today's one of those days where you earn that drink discount.

You knock on the door of Xain, an Orchid who switched from providing assurances to providing excuses. He opens up, and you let him know it's time to settle his tab.

"Oh, c'mon, he sent the Jaws? Right, okay... problem is, you're a day early. I've got a lot of gold coming my way, huge haul on some bets. Guaranteed money."

You notice some packed bags inside the doorway. Xain speaks up, "Oh, that's nothing. Was just my plan B, no big deal. Don't need that anymore. I'm rolling in cash! Or at least, I will be tomorrow. Heck, I'd even be willing to toss you something for the delay."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Not buying it. He pays up now.

outcomes.narrative: You shake Xain down for whatever he's got on him. He whines about not having the gold, but you gather enough to pay most of his debt. To make up the difference, you help yourself to a trinket on your way out. It might be useful, or you could just pawn it for drinking money.

options.label: B
options.narrative: A little trust goes a long way. Come back tomorrow.

outcomes.narrative:
You walk into the Sleeping Lion the next day to find Xain waiting for you. He's sporting a set of thick gold rings, and an ostentatious necklace hangs low around his neck, catching the light.

"Friends! Haha! Welcome, drinks are on me! Told you I'd be rolling in it! Oh, and a small tip for your trust..."

events.narrative:
For a long while, you'd bring your laundry to the Savvas along the river by the Ward of Scales. But after your last battle with some giant vipers, the Savvas refused to take your business, afraid of where the blood ended and the poison began. Most recently, you've been bringing your laundry to a stocky Quatryl who runs an automatic washing house. He doesn't mind the condition of what you drop off or ask any questions about how they got that way.

"Hello again!" he shouts with a toothy smile as you walk in. But then, noticing the uncomfortable stares of his more delicate customers at the sight of the venom dripping off your armor onto the floor, he adds "...err, for the first time. How can I help?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Drop off your dirty clothes and armor for cleaning and mending.

outcomes.narrative: You hand over your clothes and armor, and the machines get to work, dipping your vestments into hot cauldrons of soapy water, wringing them out, and buffeting them with bursts of steam. The Quatryl identifies holes or rips and queues up automatic sewing arms to repair each issue. The whole process funnels into a complicated loom of wires that somehow folds your clothes into a tight package for delivery, and a chute drops the pile back to you, letting out a last toot of satisfied steam.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Take the hint and come back later.

outcomes.narrative: You act confused and lost, pretend to be looking for the armory, and then come back a few hours later to see the Quatryl. "All the money is in the fancy clothes, but all the challenge is in blood-stained armor." As thanks for your discretion, he offers you a gift: an item from another adventurer who never came back to claim it.

events.narrative:
"I'll have you know, I have the ear of Councilman Greymare! He would be quite interested to hear the outrageous prices you're charging for routine tailoring! Primitive! You—you thick-skulled barbarian!" A short, bearded man continues shouting as he walks out of a tailor in the Mixed District. "I'll hem my own clothes. It certainly can't be that difficult if you've made a business of it!"

With that, he turns and promptly trips over his robes, dashing the leather-bound books he was carrying all over the cobblestone street. At least one of them looks interesting...

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help him gather his scattered books.

outcomes.narrative: You hand over the last of the books as he dusts himself off. "Hmph! Well, thank you. Ah—the Jaws. Dominic Scrim, good to make your acquaintance. I wish the rest of these mercenaries were as helpful as you lot. Maybe there are some good among you. A token of my gratitude..."

options.label: B
options.narrative: Grab the most interesting volume in the confusion.

outcomes.narrative:
You snatch an elegant book bound in dark leather and turn to a random page:

"...in the darkness of his cave, insane and broken. The harbingers of the Upheaval, a great army of demons, had succeeded in bringing a once-powerful and glorious civilization to its complete and utter end..."

Must be some fantasy novel. You drop it in an alley and move on.

events.narrative:
You're walking along the stalls of the Sinking Market when a display of exotic fruit catches your eye. The proprietor walks you through a few of the offerings: grain-cherries, blood melon—even a hard nut that can be broken open to reveal sweet milk. You start discussing which to purchase with your companions and the shopkeep's attention turns to other interested patrons.

Out of the corner of your eye, you see a young Vermling reach up to swipe some red berries from a display basket.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Alert the shopkeep.

outcomes.narrative:
The shopkeep swats the Vermling's hand away.

"Here, take this and get lost. And I don't want to see you around my stall for at least a week!"

He tosses the Vermling a squishy-looking gourd, and she rushes away. The shopkeep thanks you with a bit of coin for your perceptiveness.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Let it slide. It's not your problem.

outcomes.narrative: The Vermling crams a handful of the berries into her mouth. Juice runs down the child's chin as she rushes away—but she makes it no more than a few steps before collapsing to the ground, gasping for air. The shopkeep immediately realizes what happened. "Idiot! Red tin-berries are poisonous!" He leans down, popping a green berry from his pocket into the Vermling's mouth. "That should counteract the poison." After a moment, she sputters back to life and darts into the nearest sewer grate.

events.narrative:
You're walking along the river toward the barracks when a Lurker, six feet tall with terrifying snapping claws, bursts out of the water on the opposite bank. The citizenry flee for cover in a mad panic.

Suddenly, a battle cry rings out, and you see a streak of shimmering purple drop from a nearby building, tucking and rolling to an elegant stop a few feet from the trouble. A Valrath woman with flowing hair stands, a shroud covering her face.

"Tiss! Tissss!" she shouts, clapping a strange wooden instrument at the beast. "Tiss!" The Lurker pauses its assault and turns to the woman. Is this horrible monster...confused?

options.label: A
options.narrative: Attack the Lurker while it's distracted. This may be the only chance to kill it.

outcomes.narrative:
While the Lurker is transfixed by the woman dressed in purple and her strange noises, you leap in and slay the aquatic beast. You turn to thank the Valrath for her distraction, but her face is a mix of horror and fury. "Why did you kill it!?" she demands as her eyes tear up. "It was just a child!"

You quickly excuse yourself and continue to the barracks, leaving the woman crying over the broken shell of the Lurker.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Pull back the onlookers and allow the woman space.

outcomes.narrative:
You hold the frightened crowd at bay and watch as the woman circles the Lurker, clapping her instrument in a hypnotic rhythm.

You almost fall into a trance yourself as you watch her work, the monster's eyes following her dance. Slowly, the pair approach the water, and with one last "Tissss" the Lurker recedes. The whole crowd breathes a sigh of relief, and the interloper nods her thanks before she turns and fades into the crowd.

events.narrative:
New wanted posters are going up around town featuring someone that looks strangely like one of your party members. You'd need to reposition their nose a bit and maybe throw a hood over their head, but you could probably collect on the fifteen-gold bounty.

After a bit of banter, you all agree that would be crazy. Even if you convinced the guards your party member was this crook and got the bounty, they'd have to escape from jail afterward. It certainly wouldn't be worth it. Just crazy-talk between good friends. Heh. No way, no how, not these buddies. Thick as—

options.label: A
options.narrative: Call for the guards.

outcomes.narrative: You call for the guards and attempt to frame your friend. Unfortunately, you can't keep a straight face long enough to seal the deal. The guards chastise you for wasting their time as your friend holds a bandage over their bleeding nose.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Call for the guards, loudly.

outcomes.narrative: Despite your friend's protests, the guards arrest them. You collect the reward and make your friend pay their own bail. You'll be laughing about this prank for years. Most of you, at least.

events.narrative:
You decide to spend your evening slumming it at the Brown Door, a dive bar in the Old Docks. Sitting in the back of the room you see an old man hunched over a set of glass beads. He cheerfully invites you to sit at his table, happy for the company. He pours some beads into his fist, placing the rest carefully into his breast pocket.

"Care to guess how many beads I have in this hand here? Get it right and I'll make it worth your while. It's tougher than it looks!"

He laughs at what you assume must have been a joke, but before you've had a chance to guess, a voice whispers into your ear: "It's always three." When you turn to look, there's no one there.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Guess a number from one to five. (Say the number aloud now.)

outcomes.narrative: The old man opens his hand with a dramatic flair and a smile. "You hear them too, don't you? First ones tonight." He chuckles to himself and spends the rest of the night lost in a drink, but not before tossing you your winnings.
The old man pops open his hand to show three gleaming glass beads. He snickers, as though it was a joke you should've seen coming.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Go looking for the voice.

outcomes.narrative:
You can hear the faintest whispering, like a dull roar over the performer on stage. You follow it outside, down the street, and behind a warehouse. Crouched over a small globe are two Aesthers, who are startled as you walk up.

"Oh, sorry. You could hear that?" The Aesther taps on the glass globe. Under his breath he mumbles, "Rotated the diamond too much..." then stops acknowledging you entirely. You walk away with more questions than before.

events.narrative:
A black plume of smoke twists through the air over the center of town. You follow it to find a crowd gathered along the Silent Bridge, cheering and clapping. Pushing to the front, you see two enormous mechanical butterfly wings strapped to a small Quatryl.

"Today, the Quatryls conquer the sky!" He pushes a button on his chest, causing the wings to start flapping and more smoke to pour out. The wings pick up speed, blasting gusts of air across the onlookers. With a wide smile, he rises up and up...before tumbling down into the river with a dramatic splash.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Dive in to help the Quatryl.

outcomes.narrative:
You dive through the billowing smoke and into the frigid water. The Quatryl's limbs are tangled in the wreckage of his wings, but you're able to pull him free and make slow progress toward the riverbank.

His eyes open wide when he realizes who saved him. "The Jaws? Oh, wow, I'm a big fan!" And while you can't be sure if it was the impact or meeting you, he passes out. Nevertheless, you saved a life today.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Hold back the crowd in case the machine explodes.

outcomes.narrative:
As the wreckage burns in the river, the inventor's limp body washes up on the river bank. The concerned crowd looks on in silence, fearing the worst.

Suddenly, the Quatryl's eyes pop open. "IT WORKED!" he shouts. He sits up and begins tinkering with the bits of machinery still strapped to his chest. "I know exactly how to fix that. A few more adjustments and I'll be soaring over the Coppernecks!"

events.narrative:
Your party is wandering in the Sinking Market when you come across a commotion just inside one of the storefronts. A dead Vermling lies on the ground, killed by a blow to the head.

The Valrath suspect says: "The Orchid did it!"

The Vermling suspect says: "The Valrath is telling the truth!"

The Inox suspect says: "If the Valrath is lying, the Vermling is lying."

The Orchid suspect says: "It wasn't the Vermling!"

A pair of guards are scratching their heads when a portal opens a short distance away, and an Aesther in an unusual hat steps out. He looks past you and says, "Only one of them is telling the truth." Before you have a chance to inquire further, he's gone.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Who is the killer? (Say the answer along now.)

outcomes.narrative: The guards take away the offender, a Vermling who killed his brother for the insurance money. You make sure to put in a bad word for the lying Valrath and Orchid, too. The Inox gets little more than a gruff "thanks" from the guards for his insightful comment, but they're happy to hand over the reward money to you.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Who is the killer? (Say the answer along now.)

outcomes.condition: if you didn't say the Vermling
outcomes.narrative:
Thinking about it later, you realize if the Valrath was telling the truth, then the Vermling was telling the truth. There could be only one who was truthful, so they both must have been lying. The Inox must have then been telling the truth, which means the Orchid was lying about it not being the Vermling.

In retrospect, it seems you made the wrong choice and the murderer went free.

events.narrative:
"A witch!" an Inox dockworker slurs loudly from the corner of the Sleeping Lion. "She came outta the sewers and turned the foreman into a—*hic*—into a fish!" You turn back to your drink, but the man keeps shouting. "I'll stake three days' pay for anyone who can kill her!" Suddenly, you are interested in his ramblings.

You follow the drunk's directions which, predictably, get you hopelessly lost in the network of sewers under Gloomhaven. You're considering just tunneling to the surface when you hear scratching behind you. You draw your weapons and turn, ready for a fight. An ancient Valrath stands feebly before you, bent and wizened with age. A cord of dried fish hangs around her neck. She ignores your weapons and silently points a gnarled finger past you, down a nearby passage.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Cut her down and claim the reward.

outcomes.narrative: Sometimes dockworkers tell tall tales. This is not one of those times. Before you can even bring your weapon to bear, the witch is on you like a demon, clawing and biting. After a long battle you emerge victorious and limp back to the inn. The Inox is even drunker than when you left him, but he honors his bounty—which you remind him was four days' pay. As you nurse your wounds over a pint, you reflect that it's a shame dockworkers aren't better compensated.

options.label: B
options.narrative: She's just an old hermit in the sewer. Leave her be and follow where she pointed.

outcomes.narrative: You wave farewell and start down the passage, but the crone follows close behind. She wasn't pointing your way out, but instead, guiding you toward a small hovel where a cauldron bubbles over an anemic campfire. The Valrath pours each of you a cup of the most delicious fish soup you've ever tasted, and, after a pleasant time sipping in silence, you leave feeling much heartier. You wonder why the dockworker would make such unkind accusations against that poor sewer hermit.

events.narrative:
Test your strength! Are you stronger than an Inox?

A man barks challenges to passersby on a street corner next to a strength-testing machine. A mallet sits at the ready for anyone brave enough to whack the base of the device and try to ring the bell at the top.

Fantastic prizes for the strongest, crushing defeat for the weakest! Just five gold per whack!

options.label: A
options.narrative: Take a swing.

effects: Each character performs an “Attack 3” action, drawing one attack modifier card, and individually reads the outcome based on the value of their swing:

outcomes.narrative: Weakling! Don't hurt yourself.
Not bad! Good swing.
DING! Incredible! You're stronger than an Inox!

options.label: B
options.narrative: Doesn't this Orchid know who you are? The Jaws of the Lion don't need to prove themselves to anybody—these games are only for kids anyway.

outcomes.narrative: You walk away, reassuring yourself you already know how strong you are. The children taunting you from the sidelines don't even hurt your feelings.

events.narrative:
You're walking through the Coin District when a woman in green with thick goggles springs from a nearby window and bowls you over. Coins and expensive trinkets scatter as they spill from the robber's pockets. She brushes herself off, then notices two guards peering down the alley, their attention drawn by the commotion.

"Hahaha! That was a good one!" She laughs dramatically and claps you on the back, making a show of it for the guards. She winces as someone shrieks "Thief!" from the window. The guards break into a run toward you, and the woman mutters, "Follow my lead, and we all get out of this. Otherwise, we're all getting sent to the Ghost Fortress, got it?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Turn her over to the guards.

outcomes.narrative:
You point to the thief and open your mouth, but she beats you to the punch. "They did it! They jumped out that window and nearly trampled me to death!" She clutches the stolen pearls around her neck. "Please, guards, arrest them!"

The guards ignore your confused protests and put you in iron cuffs. By the time they turn around to further question their witness, she's already gone. Even after that, it takes a little extra grease before they let you go.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Let the thief work her charms.

outcomes.narrative:
"They went that way!" The green-clad woman swoons against the building as the guards approach, pointing farther off into the dark alley. "Please, you have to do something. I think they killed someone!"

The guards look at each other and charge into the shadows. "See? That wasn't so hard, was it?" the burglar quips as she bends down to grab a fallen valuable. "Here, for your trouble. Now, you'd better clear out before they return."

events.narrative:
You enter the Sleeping Lion to find your old friend, Xain, sitting at the bar. The barkeep is doing his best to ignore him. Xain's face lights up as you walk in.

"Jaws! Friends! My only true companions!" Xain cheers. "I assume you're here to pay me my management fee?"

You look at him quizzically. He speaks more slowly. "My fee? For managing the reputation of the Jaws of the Lion. I know you haven't been keeping track of what people think of you, but I have. Heck, I'm the one who started calling you guys ‘The Jaws' in the first place! Branding, y'know? Surely that's worth something."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Pay Xain for promoting your reputation around town.

outcomes.narrative: Xain assures you your reputation is impeccable. "I've been talking you up quite a bit around town, and the shops have agreed to a small discount just so you're seen around their stores."
effects: Until the start of the next scenario, you may purchase items from the shop for 5 gold less than their cost.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Refuse to pay Xain. If your reputation was that important, you'd track it yourself.

outcomes.narrative:
Xain shakes his head. "Wow, someone's really going to get a ding on their reputation. I'm marking this down."

He checks a box in a ledger of his, then mutters one more thing as he wanders off: "This is going to have a real effect on you."

events.narrative:
Standing outside the Sanctuary of the Great Oak is a man with a powerful voice. Dressed in white vestments, he shouts to the assembled crowd.

"It is time for tithing to the Great Oak! Donate to the preservation of its majesty, and it will bless you with prosperity never before seen!" He passes a rough-hewn wooden bowl amongst the crowd.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Donate to the Sanctuary of the Great Oak.

outcomes.narrative: You push to the front, eager to set an example for the rest of the crowd. The Keeper of the Oak gazes at you approvingly as many more follow your lead.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Plenty of other people donating. The Sanctuary will have a good week even without your contribution.

outcomes.narrative: The Keeper of the Oak sees you try to sneak off into the crowd without being noticed. He looks unimpressed and mutters something under his breath.

events.narrative:
You enter the Sleeping Lion and find Xain, a local barmate who always seems down on his luck for one reason or another, sitting at the counter. The barkeep has just refused to bring him another drink until he pays off his tab, but Xain perks up when he sees you approach.

"Oh, perfect, it's the Jaws! Seems like this is as good a time as any to cash in on that drink you all owe me. Whaddaya say?"

You don't remember owing him a drink. In fact, you're pretty sure he was supposed to buy your next round after you helped clear an imp out of his garden.

options.label: A
options.narrative: It's one drink, no need to kick the guy when he's down. Buy it for him.

outcomes.narrative: You cough up a few coins to spot Xain a drink, and you see a hint of relief play across his face. After a few rounds, you're having a good enough time that the difference doesn't matter anyway. The real experiences are the friends you made along the way.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Remind Xain of the actual score.

outcomes.narrative: You list off the reasons you don't owe Xain a drink: the time you unglued him from the city walls, the time you delivered his box of vipers to the dockyard, the time he accidentally trapped a demon in his belt buckle, the time you broke up a fight between him and a rock he thought was a Savvas, the time you had to wean him off stamina potions, the time you had to wean him off major stamina potions, and the time you removed the "harrower hive" from his kitchen that turned out to be ants from a dropped pie. You sigh, then buy him a drink anyway.

events.narrative:
A Valrath woman wearing a red cloak and flanked by two Inox bodyguards enters the Sleeping Lion. Heads turn as she approaches your table, and she settles in across from your party. The two bodyguards stand a few feet away, eyeing the rest of the patrons.

"You may call me Jekserah. Pleased to make your acquaintance." Her hand, heavily adorned in gold rings, idly traces the grain of the wooden table. "I have an important caravan coming in to town. Once it arrives, I'd like your assistance in bringing the contents to my warehouse... I require the services of the best. That is you, isn't it?" A smile plays across her lips.

Something about the whole exchange rubs you the wrong way. What could you provide that these hulking Inox couldn't?

options.label: A
options.narrative: Agree to help unload the caravan.

outcomes.narrative:
You arrive at the west gate, but the caravan is nowhere to be found. Jekserah is shouting angrily at her bodyguards—apparently the shipment was stolen in transit. You inquire about payment anyway.

"I'm not going to pay you for doing nothing!" You press the issue, since you held up your part of the bargain. She eventually passes you a few coins, but makes it clear you won't be working together again. The feeling is mutual.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Refuse the woman. Something is off.

outcomes.narrative: She doesn't take kindly to being refused—it seems your response isn't something she encounters often. She stands from the table in a huff: "You think you're the only mercenaries in this town? I'll find some other idiots to do my bidding."

events.narrative:
You are minding your own business in the Sleeping Lion when a rough-looking Inox sea captain rushes up to your table.

"I've been told you're the folks to talk to if you have a problem," she says. "A number of goods have gone missing from my ship at the Old Docks. I tracked the thieves to an abandoned warehouse, but I have reason to believe they may be more than I can handle."

You look up at the huge Inox one more time and then scratch your head. Could be a lucrative opportunity, so long as you don't get killed.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Demand payment upfront.

outcomes.narrative: "Do I look like a font of money to you?" the Inox yells incredulously. Your seat just got incredibly uncomfortable. "Take the job or don't, but stop wasting my time!"

options.label: B
options.narrative: Accept the job proposal.

outcomes.narrative: The Inox breathes a sign of relief, then a smile cracks across her face. "Good to know I can count on you," she says. "We outcasts have to stick together, right?" You are about to argue with her assessment of you when she produces some extra coin as thanks.

events.narrative:
You notice a well-dressed Valrath merchant entering the Sleeping Lion, looking completely out of place. He scans the room, grimacing in disgust at any number of the activities going on inside. Eventually, he spots your table and approaches.

"I have need of your services, mercenaries," he says through a perfumed handkerchief. He claims there is trouble at the New Docks. It seems there have been some strange happenings no one can explain: goods moving or disappearing altogether, eerie noises, visions of horrible demons. "I hope you are able to investigate and stop whatever forces may be conspiring to topple our economic supremacy."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Demand payment upfront.

outcomes.narrative: The Valrath looks horrified by your aggressiveness, but he soon cracks under the pressure and throws some coins in your direction. "Fine, just take care of the problem quickly!" he demands as he runs from the establishment.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Accept the job proposal.

outcomes.narrative:
"Splendid!" the Valrath says through his handkerchief. "It seems a little money can go a long way in this place.

"So long as you can get over the smell," he adds as he turns and walks out the door.

events.narrative:
You are deep into your third drink at the Sleeping Lion when a messenger stomps in from the cold night air. You grumble a bit as the biting wind from the open door reaches your table.

The messenger appears a little lost. He is clearly looking for someone, but he isn't having much luck.

"A Red Guard," he hesitantly mumbles. "Is there a Red Guard somewhere in here?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: See what the messenger has for you (Red Guard required).

outcomes.narrative: The messenger hands over a piece of paper, and the Red Guard's expression goes dark. On the parchment is nothing but a simple image of a snake coiled around a sun, but it takes a few more drinks before the Red Guard speaks again. They explain that exile from the Red Order in Jhinda typically means death, but the Red Guard fled to Gloomhaven, and now fate has caught up with them. There is a location written on the back. The Red Guard must go soon or they will be hunted.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Do your best to ignore the man and the wind.

outcomes.narrative: The messenger eventually leaves, looking even more confused than when he entered.

events.narrative:
You are enjoying a lunch of unidentifiable meat purchased from a Quatryl street vendor on the Silent Bridge when you run across a curious poster. It advertises there will be a large fighting competition in Gloomhaven Square in a matter of days.

At first, you discount it as not something worth your time, but perhaps you could be interested, if you have something to prove.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Sign up for the competition (Hatchet required).

outcomes.narrative: The Hatchet is very eager to join the competition and prove they are the greatest fighter, and so you oblige. It is an individual competition, though, so the rest of you will have to cheer from the sidelines.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Ignore the poster and continue enjoying your lunch.

outcomes.narrative: The meat is very enjoyable, though it does result in some stomach pains an hour or so later.

events.narrative:
Your purse is quite empty after a bad night of gambling at the Sleeping Lion. You are contemplating how best to cheat without getting caught when an intense negative feeling washes over you.

At first, you assume it is guilt, but you have your suspicions that it could be something far worse. You try to focus on the game, but something terrible keeps nagging at you.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Attempt to find the root of the negative energy (Voidwarden required).

outcomes.narrative: The Voidwarden exits the Sleeping Lion and holds a hand up to the sky. Very quickly, they turn to the rest of the group with a panicked expression. The Voidwarden warns that something is wrong with the Void. Whatever rests inside it is stirring, and something terrible is coming as a result.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Shake the nagging feeling and concentrate on the game.

outcomes.narrative: Eventually, your luck turns, and you are at least able to recover your lost money. You suppose the feeling wasn't so negative after all.

events.narrative:
You are having a nice stroll through the New Market, perusing incredibly expensive wares you could never afford, when you spot a gruff looking man wading through the crowd. He seems out of place.

If you had to guess, you'd say he was some sort of carpenter. As he approaches, you get the feeling that you know him, but you can't quite figure out why.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Greet the man (Demolitionist required).

outcomes.narrative: The man's face lights up as you approach. You recognize him as the Demolitionist's old boss. It turns out he's actually glad to have run across you, as he has a job that you may be uniquely suited for. He has a building in the Coin District that needs to be demolished. A wealthy merchant bought the property out from under someone else to expand his own estate. The trouble is that the previous owner is said to have cursed it in a fit of rage. Destroying it may be tricky.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Ignore the feeling and carry on with your business.

outcomes.narrative: After a little more walking, you find a truly amazing tapestry embroidered with a great battle scene between humans and Valraths, said to be recovered from an ancient storehouse in Demonsgate. It is worth more money than you've spent in your entire life.

286.text: Verliere eine Karte um 5 oder mehr Schaden zu negieren.

287.text: Beende deine Züge immer angrenzend an eine Wand oder ein Hindernis.

288.text: Sammle weniger Münzmarker als jeder andere Charakter.

jotl.25: The Greatest Job in the World

286.text: Pierde 1 carta para prevenir 5 de daño o más.

287.text: Termina todos tus turnos adyacente a una pared u obstáculo.

288.text: Recoge menos fichas de Dinero que cualquiera de los otros personajes.

289.text: Mata a un monstruo al que haya atacado cualquiera de tus aliados antes en la misma ronda.

290.text: No abandones nunca un hexágono adyacente a un monstruo.

291.text: Mata al último monstruo que muera en el escenario.

292.text: No pierdas nunca una carta para prevenir daño.

293.text: No permitas que tus puntos de vida desciendan por debajo de la mitad de tu valor máximo (redondeando hacia arriba).

294.text: Recoge más fichas de Dinero que cualquiera de los otros personajes.

295.text: Termina el escenario con una cantidad de puntos de vida igual a tu valor máximo.

296.text: Mata a un monstruo con un ataque tenga Desventaja.

297.text: Realiza 2 acciones con iconos de carta perdida antes de tu primer descanso.

298.text: Sufre daño de un ataque en la misma ronda que haces un descanso largo.

299.text: Termina el escenario con 3 puntos de vida o menos.

300.text: Mata a un monstruo y saquea la ficha de Dinero que deje en el mismo turno.

301.text: Sé el primero en matar a un monstruo durante el escenario.

303.text: Recoge 1 o más fichas de Dinero realizando una acción de Saqueo mientras estás adyacente a 2 o más monstruos.

304.text: Sé el objetivo de los ataques de 3 o más monstruos en la misma ronda.

305.text: No mates nunca a un monstruo de élite o a un jefe.

307.text: Realiza 2 acciones con iconos de perdida en el mismo turno.

308.text: No termines nunca tu turno adyacente a ninguno de tus aliados.

311.text: Termina todos tus turnos adyacente a cualquiera de tus aliados.

312.text: Mata a un monstruo que no esté adyacente a ti mientras tú estás adyacente a otro monstruo.

313.text: No realices nunca una acción básica.

315.text: En el mismo turno, abre una puerta y termina en la sala revelada.

316.text: Aplica cualquier estado negativo a un monstruo mientras tengas cualquier estado negativo.

317.text: Acaba agotado antes de ninún otro personaje.

286.text: При прохождении сценария положить карту в стопку «Потери», чтобы предотвратить получение 5 или более единиц урона.

287.text: При прохождении сценария каждый ваш ход заканчивать на клетке, соседней со стеной или препятствием.

288.text: При прохождении сценария добыть меньше монет, чем любой другой персонаж.

289.text: При прохождении сценария убить монстра, уже атакованного союзником в текущем раунде.

290.text: При прохождении сценария не передвигаться с клетки, соседней с монстром.

291.text: При прохождении сценария последним убить монстра.

292.text: При прохождении сценария не класть карты в стопку «Потери» для отмены урона.

293.text: При прохождении сценария не допустить, чтобы ваше текущее количество ОЗ опускалось ниже половины вашего максимального количества ОЗ (с округлением вверх).

294.text: При прохождении сценария добыть больше монет, чем любой другой персонаж.

295.text: В конце сценария ваше текущее количество ОЗ должно быть равно вашему максимальному количеству ОЗ.

296.text: При прохождении сценария убить монстра атакой с затруднением.

297.text: При прохождении сценария применить две способности с символом «Потери» до вашего первого отдыха.

298.text: При прохождении сценария получить урон от атаки в том раунде, в котором вы объявили долгий отдых.

299.text: В конце сценария ваше текущее количество ОЗ должно быть не больше 3.

300.text: При прохождении сценария в один и тот же ваш ход убить монстра и добыть появившуюся на поле после его смерти монету.

301.text: При прохождении сценария первым убить любого монстра.

302.text: При прохождении сценария убить не больше 3 монстров.

303.text: При прохождении сценария, находясь на клетке, соседней с двумя или более монстрами, добыть не меньше одной монеты с помощью действия «Добыча».

304.text: При прохождении сценария в одном и том же раунде стать целью атаки для 3 или более монстров.

305.text: При прохождении сценария не убивать мощных монстров и боссов.

306.text: При прохождении сценария не использовать зелья.

307.text: При прохождении сценария в один и тот же ваш ход применить две способности с символом «Потери».

308.text: При прохождении сценария не заканчивать ваш ход на клетке, соседней с союзником.

309.text: При прохождении сценария убить не меньше 5 монстров.

310.text: При прохождении сценария не использовать долгий отдых.

311.text: При прохождении сценария каждый ваш ход заканчивать на клетке, соседней с союзником.

312.text: При прохождении сценария, находясь на соседней с монстром клетке, убить другого монстра, находящегося не на соседней с вами клетке.

313.text: При прохождении сценария не использовать стандартные способности.

314.text: При прохождении сценария не использовать передышку.

315.text: При прохождении сценария в один и тот же ваш ход открыть дверь и закончить движение в открытой комнате.

316.text: При прохождении сценария, находясь в отрицательном состоянии, наложить на монстра отрицательное состояние.

317.text: При прохождении сценария стать первым изнурённым персонажем.

mech.hint: Ваше максимальное количество ОЗ увеличено на 5. Выполните «%game.action.heal% 10 (на себя)».

21.2: Персонажи получают %game.damage:[L/2{$math.floor}]% за каждую клетку, на которую перемещаются в комнате с Демоном хаоса %game.mapMarker.A%

286.text: 遺失一張卡牌來抵銷5點或更多傷害。

287.text: 你每個回合結束時都與牆壁或障礙物相鄰。

288.text: 收取的錢幣標記比其他任何一位角色要少。

289.text: 消滅1個同一輪中你盟友之前攻擊過的怪物。

290.text: 從不離開怪物的相鄰格。

291.text: 消滅本劇本中最後一個死亡的怪物。

292.text: 從不遺失卡牌來抵銷承受傷害。

293.text: 從不讓你的生命跌至你生命值上限的一半以下(向上取整)。

294.text: 收取的錢幣標記比其他任何一位角色都要多。

295.text: 劇本結束時生命值等於你生命值上限。

296.text: 使用具有劣勢的攻擊消滅1個怪物。

297.text: 在你第一次休息前執行2個帶有遺失圖標的行動。

298.text: 你充分休息的同一輪承受攻擊傷害。

299.text: 劇本結束時生命為3點或更低。

300.text: 消滅1個怪物並在同一回合中拾取其掉落的錢幣。

301.text: 消滅本劇本中第一個死亡的怪物。

302.text: 消滅的怪物少於等於3個。

303.text: 你與2個及以上怪物相鄰時，通過執行拾取行動收取了至少1個錢幣標記。

304.text: 同一輪中成為3個及以上怪物攻擊的目標。

305.text: 從未消滅過精英怪物和頭目。

307.text: 在同一個回合執行了2個帶有遺失圖標的行動。

308.text: 你回合結束時從不與你的任何盟友相鄰。

311.text: 你每個回合結束時均與你的盟友相鄰。

312.text: 你與一個怪物相鄰時消滅另一個不與你相鄰的怪物。

315.text: 打開房門且當回合結束時停留在揭示的房間內。

316.text: 你擁有負面狀態的情況下對1個怪物施加負面狀態。

317.text: 先於任何其他角色精疲力盡。

mech.hint: 你的最大生命值增加 5 點。治療自己 %game.action.heal% 10。

basic-vermling-raider.1: 在回合結束後洗混此牌庫。
basic-vermling-raider.2: 他們會移動以避免與其目標相鄰。
basic-vermling-raider.4: 這正是他們在上一場劇本中的行動方式。

blood-horror.1: 跳躍到最遠且死亡 %data.monster.zealot% 並將其復活，或跳向最遠的角色並執行 %game.action.attack%+0
blood-horror.2: 復活房間內所有死亡的 %data.monster.zealot%

jotl-14.1: Reichere das Schlachtfeld während deines Zugs mit einem beliebigen Element an.

jotl-15.1: Wende während deines Zugs "%game.action.heal% 1" bei dir an.

jotl-16.1: %game.element.consume.wild% bei deinem Angriff, um der gesamten Aktion +1 %game.action.attack% hinzuzufügen.

jotl-17.1: Die untere Standardaktion einer Fertigkeitskarte gilt als "%game.action.move% 3" statt "%game.action.move% 2".

jotl-18.1: Verwandle deine nächste Einzelziel-Nahkampf-Angriffsfertigkeit in folgendes:

jotl-19.1: Füge bei deinem Fernangriff einem Einzelangriff %game.condition.curse% hinzu.

jotl-2.1: Wenn du angegriffen wirst, gilt jeder gezogene %game.attackmodifier.double% Angriffsmodifikator des Gegners stattdessen als %game.attackmodifier.plus0%.

jotl-20.1: Füge bei deinem Angriff einem Einzelangriff %game.condition.stun% hinzu.

jotl-21.1: Füge bei deinem Fernangriff der gesamten Aktion +1 %game.action.range% hinzu.

jotl-22.1: Wenn du durch einen Angriff Schaden erleidest, erhältst du%game.action.shield% 2 für den Angriff und der Angreifer erleidet 2 Schaden.

jotl-24.1: Verwandle deine nächste Einzelziel-Fernkampf-Angriffsfertigkeit in Folgendes:

jotl-25.1: Füge bei deinem Fernangriff einem Einzelangriff %game.action.pull% 2 hinzu.

jotl-27.1: Zwinge während deines Zugs einen Gegner in %game.action.range:3%, nach deinem Wunsch "%game.action.move% 2" anzuwenden.

jotl-28.1: Für die Berechnung des Gegnerfokus ist dein Initiative-Wert 99.

jotl-29.1: Wenn du durch einen Angriff Schaden erleidest, erhältst du %game.action.shield% 2 für den Angriff.

jotl-3.1: Erhalte während deines Zugs %game.action.shield% 1 für den Rest der Runde

jotl-30.1: Spiele am Ende deines Zugs eine Handkarte aus und wende die untere Aktion sofort an.

jotl-33.1: Wenn du durch einen Angriff Schaden erleidest, erhältst du %game.action.shield% 4 für den Angriff.

jotl-34.1: Füge bei deinem Angriff der gesamten Aktion %game.condition.wound% hinzu.

jotl-35.1: Während deines Zugs darf ein angrenzender Verbündeter "%game.action.attack% 2" ausführen.

jotl-36.1: Füge einer deiner Einzelbewegungen +1 %game.action.move% und %game.action.jump% hinzu.

jotl-4.1: Wenn du angegriffen wirst, erhältst du, bevor Angriffsmodifikator-Karten gezogen werden, für diesen Angriff %game.action.shield% 1 und der Angreifer Nachteil.

jotl-6.1: Füge während deiner gesamten Bewegungsaktion %game.action.jump% hinzu.

jotl-7.1: Wenn du durch einen Angriff Schaden erleidest, erhältst du %game.action.shield% 1 für den Angriff.

jotl-8.1: Füge bei deinem Fernangriff einem Einzelangriff %game.condition.stun% hinzu

jotl-9.1: Füge bei deinem Nahkampfangriff einem Einzelangriff %game.condition.poison% hinzu.

jotl-11.1: During your turn, perform a "%game.action.heal% 3, Self" action.

jotl-13.1: During your attack, add +1 %game.action.attack% to your entire Attack action.

jotl-16.1: During your attack, %game.element.consume.wild% to add +1 %game.action.attack% to the entire Attack action.

jotl-18.1: During your single-target melee attack action, turn the attack into the following:

jotl-19.1: During your ranged attack, add %game.condition.curse% to a single attack.

jotl-2.1: When attacked, consider any %game.attackmodifier.double% attack modifier card the enemy draws to be a %game.attackmodifier.plus0% instead.

jotl-20.1: During your attack, add %game.condition.stun% to a single attack.

jotl-21.1: During your ranged attack, add +1 %game.action.range% to your entire Attack action.

jotl-22.1: When damaged by an attack, gain %game.action.shield% 2 for the attack and the attacker suffers 2 damage.

jotl-23.1: During your movement, add +2 %game.action.move% to a single movement.

jotl-24.1: During your single-target ranged attack action, turn the attack into the following:

jotl-25.1: During your ranged attack, add %game.action.pull% 2 to a single attack.

jotl-26.1: During your turn, perform a "%game.condition.bless%, %game.action.range:5%" action.

jotl-27.1: During your turn, force one enemy within %game.action.range:3% to perform a "%game.action.move% 2" action with you controlling the action.

jotl-28.1: You are considered to have an initiative of 99 for the purpose of enemy focusing.

jotl-29.1: When damaged by an attack, gain %game.action.shield% 2 for the attack.

jotl-3.1: During your turn gain %game.action.shield% 1 for the rest of the round

jotl-30.1: At the end of your turn, play one card from your hand and immediately perform the bottom action of that card.

jotl-32.1: During your turn, perform a "%game.action.heal% 3, %game.action.range:5%" action.

jotl-33.1: When damaged by an attack, gain %game.action.shield% 4 for the attack.

jotl-34.1: During your attack, add %game.condition.wound% to the entire Attack Action.

jotl-35.1: During your turn, one adjacent ally may perform and "%game.action.attack% 2" Action.

jotl-36.1: During your movement, add +1 %game.action.move% and %game.action.jump% to a single movement.

jotl-4.1: When attacked, the attacker gains Disadvantage on the attack and you gain %game.action.shield% 1 for the attack.

jotl-5.1: During your movement add +1 %game.action.move% to a single movement.

jotl-6.1: During your movement, add %game.action.jump% to the entire Move Action.

jotl-7.1: When damaged by an attack, gain %game.action.shield% 1 for the attack.

jotl-8.1: During your ranged attack, add %game.condition.stun% to a single attack

jotl-9.1: During your melee attack, add %game.condition.poison% to a single attack.

jotl-1.1: Durante tu ataque, gana Ventaja en la acción de ataque entera.

jotl-10.1: Durante tu Capacidad de ataque cuerpo a cuerpo con un solo objetivo, ataca a cualquier enemigo a 2 hexágonos o menos,

jotl-11.1: Durante tu turno, realiza una acción de "%game.action.heal% 3, Personal".

jotl-12.1: Durante tu turno, devuelve 1 de tus cartas descartadas a tu mano.

jotl-13.1: Durante tu ataque, añade %game.action.attack% +1 a tu acción de Ataque entera.

jotl-14.1: Durante tu turno, imbuye 1 elemento cualquiera.

jotl-15.1: Durante tu turno, realiza una acción de "%game.action.heal% 1, Personal".

jotl-16.1: Durante tu ataque, %game.element.consume.wild% para añadir %game.action.attack% +1a la acción de ataque entera.

jotl-17.1: Siempre que uses la acción básica de la mitad inferior de una carta de Capacidad, realiza una acción de "%game.action.move% 3" en lugar de "%game.action.move% 2".

jotl-18.1: Durante tu Capacidad de ataque cuerpo a cuerpo con un solo objetivo, convierte el ataque en:

jotl-19.1: Durante tu ataque a distancia, añade %game.condition.curse% a un único ataque.

jotl-2.1: Cuando te ataquen, cualquier carta de Modificador de ataque %game.attackmodifier.double% attack que robe el enemigo se considera un %game.attackmodifier.plus0%.

jotl-20.1: Durante tu ataque, añade %game.condition.stun% a un único ataque.

jotl-21.1: Durante tu ataque a distancia, añade %game.action.range% +1 a la acción de ataque entera.

jotl-22.1: Cuando sufras daño por un ataque, obten %game.action.shield% 2 contra el ataque y el atacante sufre 2 de daño.

jotl-23.1: Durante tu movimiento, añade %game.action.move% +2 a un solo movimiento.

jotl-24.1: Durante tu Capacidad de ataque a distancia con un solo objetivo, convierte el ataque en:

jotl-25.1: Durante tu ataque a distancia, añade %game.action.pull% 2 a un único ataque.

jotl-26.1: Durante tu turno, realiza una acción de "%game.condition.bless%, %game.action.range:5%".

jotl-27.1: Durante tu runo, obliga a un enemigo a %game.action.range:3% a realizar una acción de "%game.action.move% 2" controlada por ti.

jotl-28.1: Se considera que tienes iniciativa 99 a efectos de atención de los enemigos.

jotl-29.1: Cuando sufras daño por un ataque, obten %game.action.shield% 2 contra ese ataque.

jotl-3.1: Durante tu turno, obtén %game.action.shield% 1 para el resto de la ronda

jotl-30.1: Al final de tu turno, juega 1 carta de tu mano y realiza de inmediato la acción inferior de la carta.

jotl-32.1: Durante tu turno, realiza una acción de "%game.action.heal% 3, %game.action.range:5%".

jotl-33.1: Cuando sufras daño por un Ataque, obtén %game.action.shield% 4 contra ese ataque.

jotl-34.1: Durante tu atque, añade %game.condition.wound% a la acción de ataque entera.

jotl-35.1: Durante tu turno, un aliado adyacente puede realizar una acción de "%game.action.attack% 2".

jotl-36.1: Durante tu movimiento añade %game.action.move% +1 y %game.action.jump% a un único movimiento.

jotl-4.1: Cuando te ataquen, antes de robar una carta de Modificador de ataque, el atacante sufre Desventaja y tu obtienes %game.action.shield% 1 contra el ataque.

jotl-5.1: Durante tu movimiento, añade %game.action.move% +1 a un solo movimiento.

jotl-6.1: Durante tu movimiento añade %game.action.jump% a la acción de Movimiento entera.

jotl-7.1: Cuando sufras daño por un ataque, obten %game.action.shield% 1 contra ese ataque.

jotl-8.1: Durante tu ataque a distancia, añade %game.condition.stun% a un único ataque

jotl-9.1: Durante tu ataque cuerpo a cuerpo, añade %game.condition.poison% a un único ataque.

jotl-21.1: Pendant votre attaque à distance, ajoutez +1 %game.action.range% à la totalité de l'action d'Attaque.

jotl-22.1: Lorsque vous subissez des dégâts du fait d'une attaque, gagnez %game.action.shield% 2 pour cette attaque et l'attaquant subit 2 dégâts.

jotl-23.1: Pendant votre déplacement, ajoutez+2 %game.action.move% à un seul déplacement.

jotl-27.1: Pendant votre tour, forcez un adversaire à %game.action.range:3% à effectuer une action "%game.action.move% 2". Vous contrôlez cette action.

jotl-28.1: Vous êtes considéré comme possédant une initiative de 99 pour ce qui concerne la focalisation des monstres.

jotl-29.1: Lorsque vous subissez des dégâts d'une attaque, gagnez %game.action.shield% 2 pour cette attaque.

jotl-32.1: Pendant votre tour, effectuez une action "%game.action.heal% 3, %game.action.range:5%".

jotl-33.1: Lorsque vous subissez des dégâts d'une attaque, gagnez %game.action.shield% 4 pour cette attaque.

jotl-34.1: Pendant votre attaque, ajoutez %game.condition.wound% à la totalité de cette action d'Attaque.

jotl-35.1: Pendant votre tour, un allié adjacent peut effectuer une action "%game.action.attack% 2".

jotl-36.1: Pendant votre déplacement, ajoutez +1 %game.action.move% et %game.action.jump% à un seul déplacement.

jotl-4.1: Lorsque vous êtes attaqué, avant de pioché une carte Modificateur d'Attaque, pour cette attaque l'attaquant gagne Désavantage et vous gagnez %game.action.shield% 1.

jotl-5.1: Pendant votre déplacement, ajoutez +1 %game.action.move% à un seul déplacement.

jotl-6.1: Pendant votre déplacement, ajoutez %game.action.jump% à la totalité de l'action de Déplacement.

jotl-7.1: Lorsque vous subissez des dégâts d'une attaque, gagnez %game.action.shield% 1 pour cette attaque.

jotl-9.1: Pendant votre attaque de mélée, ajoutez %game.condition.poison%à une seule attaque.

jotl-11.1: В ваш ход выполните действие «%game.action.heal% 3, (на себя)».

jotl-12.1: В ваш ход верните на руку 1 карту из вашей стопки «Сброс».

jotl-13.1: Во время вашей атаки добавьте +1 %game.action.attack% ко всем атакам текущей способности.

jotl-14.1: В ваш ход повысьте заряд любой стихии.

jotl-15.1: В ваш ход выполните действие «%game.action.heal% 1 (на себя)».

jotl-16.1: Во время вашей атаки используйте %game.element.consume.wild%, чтобы добавить +1 %game.action.attack% ко всем атакам текущей способности.

jotl-17.1: Каждый раз когда вы применяете нижнюю способность карты как стандартную, выполняйте действие «%game.action.move% 3» вместо «%game.action.move% 2».

jotl-18.1: Во время вашей ближней атаки, нацеленной на одного врага, вместо этого проведите её в следующей области:

jotl-19.1: Во время вашей дальней атаки добавьте «%game.condition.curse%» к одной атаке.

jotl-2.1: Когда вас атакуют, считайте вытянутые врагами карты модификаторов атаки %game.attackmodifier.double% картами %game.attackmodifier.plus0%.

jotl-20.1: Во время вашей атаки добавьте эффект «%game.condition.stun%» к одной атаке.

jotl-21.1: Во время вашей дальней атаки добавьте +1 %game.action.range% к всем атакам текущей способности.

jotl-22.1: В случае получения урона от атаки, нацеленной на вас, получите «%game.action.shield% 2» для этой атаки. Атакующий получает 2 урона.

jotl-23.1: Во время вашего движения добавьте +2 %game.action.move% к одному действию движения.

jotl-24.1: Во время вашего действия дальней атаки, нацеленного на одного врага, вместо этого выполните его в следующей области:

jotl-25.1: Во время вашей дальней атаки добавьте эффект «%game.action.pull% 2» к одной атаке.

jotl-27.1: В ваш ход заставьте врага в пределах %game.action.range:3% выполнить под вашим управлением действие «%game.action.move% 2».

jotl-28.1: При выборе врагами цели ваша инициатива считается равной 99.

jotl-29.1: Когда вы получаете урон от атаки, получите свойство «%game.action.shield% 2» для этой атаки.

jotl-3.1: В ваш ход получите свойство «%game.action.shield% 1» на этот раунд

jotl-30.1: В конце вашего хода разыграйте 1 карту с вашей руки и немедленно примените её нижнюю способность.

jotl-33.1: Когда вы получаете урон от атаки, нацеленной на вас, получите «%game.action.shield% 4» для этой атаки.

jotl-34.1: Во время вашей атаки добавьте «%game.condition.wound%» ко всем атакам текущей способности.

jotl-35.1: В ваш ход один союзник на соседней клетке может выполнить действие «%game.action.attack% 2».

jotl-36.1: Во время вашего движения добавьте +1 %game.action.move% и эффект «%game.action.jump%» к одному действию движения.

jotl-4.1: Когда вас атакуют, эта атака проводится с затруднением, а вы получаете свойство «%game.action.shield% 1» для этой атаки.

jotl-5.1: Во время вашего движения добавьте +1 %game.action.move% к одному действию движения.

jotl-6.1: Во время вашего движения добавьте «%game.action.jump%» ко всем действиям движения текущей способности.

jotl-7.1: Когда вы получаете урон от атаки, получите свойство «%game.action.shield% 1» для этой атаки.

jotl-8.1: Во время вашей дальней атаки добавьте эффект «%game.condition.stun%» к одной атаке

jotl-9.1: Во время вашей ближней атаки добавьте эффект «%game.condition.poison%» к одной атаке.

jotl-10.1: 在你對單一目標的近戰攻擊能力中，改為攻擊任意一個 2 格內的敵人

jotl-11.1: 在你的回合中，執行"%game.action.heal% 3，自身"的動作。

jotl-12.1: 在你的回合中，將你棄牌堆中的一張卡牌返回手牌。

jotl-13.1: 在你的攻擊行動中，為整個攻擊動作附加 +1 %game.action.attack%。

jotl-14.1: 在你的回合中，注入任意一種元素。

jotl-15.1: 在你的回合中，執行"%game.action.heal% 1，自身"的動作。

jotl-16.1: 在你的攻擊行動中，%game.element.consume.wild% 以為整個攻擊動作附加 +1 %game.action.attack%。

jotl-17.1: 使用能力牌的預設下方動作時，將原本的%game.action.move% 2動作改為%game.action.move% 3。

jotl-18.1: 在你對單一目標的近戰攻擊行動中，將該攻擊轉化為以下形式：

jotl-19.1: 在你的遠程攻擊中，為其中一次攻擊附加 %game.condition.curse%。

jotl-2.1: 當你受到攻擊時，將敵人抽到的任何 %game.attackmodifier.double% 攻擊修正牌視為 %game.attackmodifier.plus0%。

jotl-20.1: 在你的攻擊行動中，為其中一次攻擊附加 %game.condition.stun%。

jotl-21.1: 在你的遠程攻擊行動中，為整個攻擊動作附加 +1 %game.action.range%。

jotl-22.1: 當受到攻擊傷害時，該次攻擊獲得 %game.action.shield% 2，並使攻擊者受到 2 點傷害。

jotl-23.1: 在你的移動行動中，為其中一次移動附加 +2 %game.action.move%。

jotl-24.1: 在你對單一目標的遠程攻擊行動中，將該攻擊轉化為以下形式：

jotl-25.1: 在你的遠程攻擊行動中，為其中一次攻擊附加 %game.action.pull% 2。

jotl-27.1: 在你的回合中，強制一名在 %game.action.range:3% 範圍內的敵人執行"%game.action.move% 2"動作，由你控制其行動。

jotl-28.1: 當敵人以你為目標，你被視為擁有 99 的時序值。

jotl-29.1: 當受到攻擊傷害時，該次攻擊獲得 %game.action.shield% 2。

jotl-3.1: 在你的回合中，獲得 %game.action.shield% 1，持續至本回合結束

jotl-30.1: 在你的回合結束時，從手牌中打出一張卡牌，並立即執行該卡的下方動作。

jotl-32.1: 在你的回合中，執行"%game.action.heal% 3，%game.action.range:5%"的動作。

jotl-33.1: 當受到攻擊傷害時，該次攻擊獲得 %game.action.shield% 4。

jotl-34.1: 在你的攻擊行動中，為整個攻擊動作附加 %game.condition.wound%。

jotl-35.1: 在你的回合中，一名相鄰的盟友可以執行"%game.action.attack% 2"動作。

jotl-36.1: 在你的移動行動中，為其中一次移動附加 +1 %game.action.move% 並附加 %game.action.jump%。

jotl-4.1: 當你受到攻擊時，使攻擊者在該次攻擊中獲得劣勢，並使你獲得 %game.action.shield% 1。

jotl-5.1: 在你的移動行動中，為其中一次移動附加 +1 %game.action.move%。

jotl-6.1: 在你的移動行動中，為整個移動動作附加 %game.action.jump%。

jotl-7.1: 當受到攻擊傷害時，該次攻擊獲得 %game.action.shield% 1。

jotl-8.1: 在你的遠程攻擊中，為其中一次攻擊附加 %game.condition.stun%

jotl-9.1: 在你的近戰攻擊中，為其中一次攻擊附加 %game.condition.poison%。
